    import {FeedbackDisplay} from 'validation-service/src/validation/formValidation/feedbackDisplay.js'
    public class | source

    FeedbackDisplay

    This Class provides display functionality. Is handles display of error messages and validation states of each field.

    Test:

    • FeedbackDisplay

    Static Public Methods

    public static checkMessageLocationDataFormat(messageLocation: null | String) source

    Checks messageLocation data for its validity

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    messageLocation null | String

    Example:

    "messageLocation": [ { "minWidth": 0, "insertTargetSelector": "[for=\"nameWithFeedbackDisplay\"]" } ]

    public static getDefaultFieldOptions(): Object source

    The Default display options for each field.

    Return:

    Object

    This data is used in getValidationFieldConfig.

    Return Properties:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    fieldShowState Boolean

    : true - Sets display actions concerning each field directly. Shows state on true, removes state on false.
    messageShow Boolean

    : true - Enables displaying of message of field. Shows message on true and invalid result.
    messageLocation null

    : null
    fieldIdForAriaUsage null

    : null
    preferHTMLValidatorMessage Boolean

    : true - Enables prefering message given in HTML over message given by validator.
    setByValidatorOnly Object

    Set by validator. Usage does not depend on validation result. These declarations are taken to operate field state actions.
    setByValidatorOnly.fieldShowStateValidSel null

    The given validator should sent a valid CSS selector String.
    setByValidatorOnly.fieldShowStateInvalidSel null

    The given validator should sent a valid CSS selector String.
    setByValidatorOnly.fieldRemoveStateSel null

    The given validator should sent a valid CSS selector String.

    Public Methods

    public getBreakpointMessageInfoLocationData(messageLocation: Object): Object | null source

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    messageLocation Object

    Return:

    Object | null

    Breakpoint depended message location data. If breakpoint is matched all properties defined in HTML for this breakpoint (via min-width property) are returned otherwise null is returned.

    Example:

    {
"minWidth": 750,
"insertTargetSelector": "#name-name-second-insert-point",
"layoutContainerIdOuter": "#validation-message-layout-name-name-second",
"layoutContainerIdNrInner": 1
}

    Reference to dom element.

    public getOptions(): Object source

    Return:

    Object

    Return Properties:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    fieldErrorClass String
    • optional
    • default: 'validation-error'
    fieldSuccessClass String
    • optional
    • default: 'validation-success'
    messageTemplate String
    • optional
    • default: look at getOptions-src-code, could not escape curly braces
    messageCreateFunction Function
    • optional
    • default: null

    public removeStatusAria(field: Object) source

    Manages aria status of field (WCAG).

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    field Object

    Dom reference.

    See:

    • https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/ARIA21.html

    public removeStatusBySelector(selector: String) source

    Removes staus classes and aria attributes of dom elements.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    selector String

    CSS selector to get dom element list.

    Params:

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    selector String

    CSS selector.
    status Boolean

    The status to show.

    public setStatusInvalidAria(field: Object, fieldIdForAriaUsage: String | null) source

    Manages aria status of field (WCAG).

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    field Object

    Reference to dom object.
    fieldIdForAriaUsage String | null

    This could be necessary to define if one message is used for several form fields.

    See:

    • https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/ARIA21.html used only if validation result is false

    Reference to dom element.
